author: algaetoken
title: Sustainable Solution Hub
description: The community generally lack education on alternative options for positive choices on Cardano that benefit their lives and the environment

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea behind this project is very relevant to the Cardano ecosystem and to its carbon footprint. However, I am not convinced it fits the campaign. I think the project would benefit from a more focused outlook, maybe engaging a specific location and then scaling to other locations.
The challenge mentioned is very relevant, as it is not easy to engage people when it comes to environmental issues, but from the proposal alone I am not sure how they will mitigate this risk.
f6_assessments.q1:
The roadmap presented seems a bit risky, as there are many activities going on in each month, but as the team members have previous experience with projects, it might be feasible. I like how they are already connecting with other hubs to execute the project, and I think it has the potential of having a bit impact on sustainability in the Cardano community. By increasing education on this topic, maybe new proposals could come up.
The budget seems a bit incomplete, as it seems to consider mainly the team's payments, but it has little mention to costs that go beyond personnel.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs are very specific and measurable and consider the many fronts of the project. There could be more KPI regarding social media including engagement, for example, not just the followers. But overall the team seems ready to assess the project's impact.

f6_assessments.q0: Sustainable Solution Hub proposal tries to address the scale-up Cardano's community hubs challenge via education. This is done by building a community hub that educate on sustainable business (Benefits, positive impacts, food securities, reduced climate impact). However, the proposal hasn't chosen any particular community to work with. While the Scale-up Cardano's Community Hubs challenge focuses on the minimum-viable hubs (MVHs), the target audience of this proposal is not  clearly identified and hence it might not deliver its full potential on impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project timeline sets target at 4 months to establish sustainable business models with the possibility of stretching it to 6 months for implementation.  
The proposer has provided LinkedIn team members profile with a mix of academia and a business professional to carry out the project. The budget will be mostly spent on content creation. While it is unclear why the legal and tax advice & consultancy will be necessary to carry out the main activity of the project which is to create the educational content. The project has a line up of collaboration with other algae projects within catalyst.
f6_assessments.q2: In this auditability section, the team has outlined 3 months it would take to complete the project which is different time period (project period is 4 months in feasibility section). The KPIs are reasonable enough if the objective is to create educational content. It reveals at the end of proposal that the project will produce educational content to promoting the Algae token. Although the proposer has a clear understanding of the challenge, it doesn't quite address the challenge well with the proposed solution. By educating public about the algae  token and how algae is served as carbon neutral energy source , it doesn't directly engage with the community hubs to drive adoption of Cardano. The proposal can be improved by including some info about algae tokens how they fit in the whole proposal to strengthen the case of driving the adoption with the tokens.

f6_assessments.q0: This project is seeking funding to build a sustainable hub that creates awareness of the Cardano ecosystem and also educates people about Cardano with a real-world solution. This is a great idea and it dialogues well with this challenge setting. This project when funded will onboard new members onto the Cardano ecosystem and also provide information to people who would not otherwise have access. This idea is stunning.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members provide a great representation of who they are with several links from their social networks, such as LinkedIn, where we can get to know them more. There is also a very detailed plan here, in which we know what would happen over a period of 4 or 3 months. The author of the project has a budget broken down and detailed to execute the proposal. In all, the idea is great and given the details provided by the team, the proposal can be implemented successfully when funded.
f6_assessments.q2: The team outlines a roadmap with clear achievable goals in each phase. In each phase, the team has provided the community with a detailed explanation of action plans to be executed and this will make auditing the proposal easier. The KPIs and milestones are clear and measurable. The team also tell us how they are going to report back to the community on their progress through a proposed website and social media.

solution: Build a community Hub providing education on sustainable business models, with real world solutions to climate issues and Cardano adoption
experience: The team over 15 years’ experience in delivering sustainable environmental projects, with expertise in higher education, scientific publications, Information systems, Enterprise resource planning and project management.
